* The amine used in preparing the polymers is preferably triethylamine, and the solvent used in preparing the polymers may be selected from tetrahydrofuran, toluene, benzene, methylethylketone, and dioxane.
* The reaction temperature is preferably between 50 and 80°C.

• The present invention provides a novel process for manufacturing 143a in an economical, industrially feasible manner using continuous gas phase hydrofluorination with heterogeneous catalysis.
• The organic feed is 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) and the fluorinating agent is HF.
• The process uses a Cr catalyst, which may be unsupported or supported, in the absence or presence of a cocatalyst selected from nickel, cobalt, and manganese salts.
• The exceptional high yields and selectivity for 143a could not have been predicted from the prior art.
• The catalysts, CrF 3 .4H 2  O and Cr/Ni/AlF 3 , have been tested under severe conditions, including high temperature and the presence of HCl and 141b, and have shown minimum change in % conversion and selectivity for 143a.
• The process can be run under adiabatic conditions, such as in a continuous, plug flow adiabatic reactor.
• The invention also includes a method for removing low level of olefinic material from 143a using hydrofluorination in the presence of HCl.

</summary>

• Exceptional high yields and selectivity for 143a not predictable from prior art
• Catalysts tested under severe conditions: CrF 3 .4H 2  O and Cr/Ni/AlF 3

• Method for removing low level of olefinic material from 143a using hydrofluorination in the presence of HCl.

• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with stable conditions and preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.
• Different weft carrying forces are produced by ejecting air under different pressures or for different intervals of time from subnozzles or by positioning subnozzle groups differently.
• The weft insertion apparatus includes a source of air under pressure, a main nozzle unit, and subnozzles arranged along the warp shed with different spacing or orifice diameters.
• The subnozzles are selectively operated depending on the weft thread to be inserted, and the air supply is controlled by on-off valves and regulators to produce the required weft carrying force.
</summary>

• Different weft carrying forces are produced by:
  • Ejecting air under different pressures from subnozzles using pressure control means or different spacing.
  • Supplying air under pressure for different intervals of time using a valve means and control means.

• The weft insertion apparatus includes:
  • A source of air under pressure.
  • A main nozzle unit with two main nozzles for two different weft threads.
  • Subnozzles arranged along the warp shed with different spacing or orifice diameters.
  • On-off valves and regulators to control air supply and produce the required weft carrying force.

• Invention relates to an improved process for preparing pyrazolotriazoles from triazolothiadiazine precursors
• Use of hypophosphorous acid in deacylation and desulfurization step reduces sulfur and sulfur-containing impurities
• Process generates less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities than without hypophosphorous acid
• Preferred embodiment: acylated compound reacted with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and pyrazolotriazole
• Wide range of inert substituents (R and R′) can be used, including hydrocarbyl, aryl, heteroaryl, and heterocyclic groups
• Radicals R and R′ selected based on properties they confer or role in utility, including cost, solubility, compatibility, and presence of reactive sites
</summary>

  • Use of hypophosphorous acid in deacylation and desulfurization step
  • Reduces sulfur and sulfur-containing impurities

• Preferred embodiment
  • Acylated compound reacted with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid
  • Produces hydrogen sulfide and pyrazolotriazole

• Inert substituents (R and R′)
  • Wide range of hydrocarbyl, aryl, heteroaryl, and heterocyclic groups
  • Selected based on properties they confer or role in utility

• Radicals R and R′
  • Selected based on cost, solubility, compatibility, and presence of reactive sites
  • Can include groups with reactive sites, such as nitro groups

• Process advantages
  • Generates less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities
  • Forms H2S by-product instead of sulfur
  • Does not reduce nitro groups or affect other functional groups
  • Straightforward and economical to carry out
  • Overcomes significant difficulties and provides several advantages in pyrazolotriazole

• The present invention is about forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers at an angle to the long axis of the fabric.
• The yarns in the layers are held together by stitching or external means like adhesive bonding.
• Traditional knitted or woven fabrics cannot provide sufficient strength for structural uses, leading to the development of non-woven fabrics.
• The most desirable non-woven fabrics have at least two layers with yarns at approximately 45° to the long axis, lying at 90° to each other.
• The rake mechanism, synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, achieves greater assurance of parallelism and allows for overlapping of successive courses for better control of strength and thickness.
• The rake mechanism accepts and retains yarns between or impales them on needles, which are formed at an angle to correspond to the approaching yarns. The yarns are then placed onto or between the appropriate needles on the conveyors using a movement opposed to the direction of travel of the conveyors.
</summary>

• Traditional methods for forming non-woven fabrics involve a series of layers that are held together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding.
• The most desirable non-woven fabrics for structural purposes have at least two layers with yarns at approximately 45° to the long axis, lying at 90° to each other.
• The rake mechanism, which is synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, achieves greater assurance of parallelism.
• The rake mechanism accepts and retains yarns between or impales them on needles, which are formed at an angle to correspond to the approaching yarns.
• The yarns are then placed onto or between the appropriate needles on the conveyors using a movement opposed to the direction of travel of the conveyors.
• The rake mechanism allows for overlapping of successive courses for better control of strength and thickness.

• The present invention provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses with covered rolls, ensuring a more accurate representation of the true nip pressure.
• The invention utilizes multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll, strategically placed to cancel rotational variability and provide a more true measurement of the pressure distribution across the nip region. Additionally, the invention allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, providing real-time information for obtaining a more accurate nip pressure profile.

• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for specialized quilting of patterns using a separate process controller for table movement and a separate computer for sewing machine functions.
• The machine includes a frame quilting table with X and Y direction movements controlled by the process controller, and a sewing machine head with its own computer for stitching and auxiliary functions.
• Key features include:
   • Separate computers for table movement and sewing machine functions, allowing for independent programming and reprogramming.
   • Use of a computer aided design program to draw and modify patterns, which are then converted into machine readable language and stored in the process controller for duplication on the quilt.
   • Ability to sew individualized patterns and duplicate them at desired locations on the quilt, increasing production efficiency and reducing the need for manual digitizing.

- The present invention relates to a method of forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to both converting and end-use applications.
- The method involves providing a first precursor web and a second precursor web, interposing a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim between them, and subjecting the construct to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface with a three-dimensional image transfer device.
- The first and second fibrous matrices in the precursor webs can be made of dissimilar fibers, and the fabric can include apertures.
- The fibrous constituent of the first precursor web and the second precursor web are deterred from becoming excessively intermingled by the intermediate support layer.
- The fabric can be subjected to post-entanglement treatments, such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions, and like processes.
- Pre-entangling of the precursor web can be effected on a foraminous surface prior to hydroentangling on the image transfer device.

</summary>

* Apparatus for treating dyed or printed textile web with a liquid
* Includes conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch
** Conveyor: endless sieve belt for transporting web horizontally
** Liquid applicator: spray pipe at first station for applying liquid during motion
** Suction device: at second station for removing liquid by suction during motion
* Dwell stretch: conducts web in spread-out condition and single layer through at least one dwell loop
** Spread-out condition: maintains tension at small level, improves washing effect
** Single-layer configuration: effective washing without soiling white background
* Suction device disposed near point of return to sieve belt, causes web to adhere and be entrained
* Compact construction: textile web guided back to sieve belt at point downstream and closely adjacent
* Two embodiments: air pass with rotating rollers or sieve drum with guide rollers
** Air pass: trio of lower rollers and pair of upper rollers, textile web forms vertically extending dwell loops
** Sieve drum: rotatably mounted above plane of upper sieve belt section, textile web travels between guide rollers over meander path
* Apparatus can be modified without departing from the spirit of the claimed invention.

* The present invention relates to methods and preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, specifically cotton, linen, or other natural fibers.
* The invention addresses the issue of poor functional durability of textile articles with cellulosic fabric materials and functional additives, such as UV protection or bacteria resistance.
* One aspect of the invention uses ultrafine wool particles or powder as carriers for functional additives, which have demonstrated exceptional carrying and retention ability.
	+ Wool fibers are pulverized into ultrafine powder and then mixed with functional additives and a binder to form a suspension.
	+ The suspension is then applied to the cellulosic fabric material using methods such as printing, padding, or foam application.
* Another aspect of the invention uses ultrafine bamboo powder as a functional additive, which has good moisture management properties.
	+ Bamboo fibers are pulverized into coarse powder, which is then suspended in water and pulverized into ultrafine powder.
	+ The ultrafine bamboo powder is then mixed with functional additives and a binder to form a finishing paste, which is applied to the cellulosic fabric material using padding or foam application methods.
* The preparations and methods of the invention provide improved functional durability and enhanced utility for textile articles with cellulosic fabric materials.

• Background: Dry cleaners have air flow systems to minimize toxic solvent vapor escape, but these systems often exhaust tub vapors to atmosphere
• Prior Art: Inexpensive solvents allowed for vapor loss, but more expensive, volatile solvents require retaining vapors within the machine
• Summary: Dry cleaning machine with separate intake fan and duct system to bring ambient air into the access opening without exhausting tub vapors
• Description of the Dry Cleaner: Machine includes tubs, cabinet, access door, solvent distributing system, air distributing system, and controls
• Solvent Flow System: During stand-by, solvent is stored in tank; during fill and wash, solvent is pumped into tubs and filtered; during dump and spin, solvent is drained and recycled or dumped; during tumble dry with heat, solvent continues to flow through filters
• Air Flow System: During stand-by with access door closed, no airflow; during fill and wash, no airflow; during drain and spin, valves open to balance air pressure; during tumble dry with heat, valves open to allow air circulation
• Elimination of Airflow through tubs during spin: Prevents uneven drying and reduces solvent loss
• Controls: Machine controlled by timer mechanism, but provision made for manually altering timer operation to dry filter cartridges without rotating tub or advancing timer
</summary>

* The invention provides a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook having holding means arranged to minimize hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop.
* All housing side holding means are located on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered and be pulled back without contacting the front cam.
* A capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, eliminating the impediment caused by the bending of the spring rod and reducing needle thread tension to a minimum.
* The design is simple, rugged, and economical, with a rotary hook arrangement including a rotatable hook housing, a spring rod extending between cams, and a projection of the housing engaging the cams.

<summary>
• The present invention pertains to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing.
• Conventional broad loom eductive and non-eductive systems have disadvantages such as high turbulence, vorticity, plugging, and hygiene issues.
• The invention uses an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments.
• The linear plane of filaments has constant filament distribution and provides good control of cross-machine uniformity.
• The quench air is used for both quenching and drawing, and the drawing chamber is relatively small with no long nozzle sections.
• Higher quench pressures can be obtained without structural deflection problems, leading to high air and fiber velocities.
• The small amount of exposed surface area collects less dirt, polymer drippings, and monomer build up.
• The necessary drawing tension can be obtained by selecting a suitable slot gap opening.
• The filament cooling is controlled by regulating the temperature of the quench fluid and controlling the rate of flow of air past the filaments.
</summary>

• The invention harnesses the positive aspects of both eductive and non-eductive systems into a more efficient and simpler design.
• The method and apparatus of the present invention solve many problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems, including spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control.
• The invention also incorporates aspects of the meltblown process to help improve web formation control.
• The molten polymer is fed from a supply, then through a screw extruder, filter, and polymer transfer pipe to a spin box containing metering pumps.
• Filaments are spun through a spinneret with appropriate openings arranged in one or more rows, forming a curtain of filaments directed into the quench chamber.
• In the quench chamber, the filaments are contacted with air or other cooling fluid, which is maintained cooler than the filaments and under pressure of less than 4 bar.
• The filaments are then directed through a narrowing lower end of the quenching chamber into the impingement point slot opening

* The present invention simplifies the continuous production process of viscose rayon yarns, allowing for acceleration and reduced space take-up without sacrificing a high degree of whiteness.
* Critical operations include completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying. Coagulation can be completed by passing time, acid treatment, or a combination of both.
* Washing reduces the amounts of sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead on the yarn to specific values. The wash water should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from excessive cations. The process produces a yarn with a high degree of white through partial coagulation and drawing, completion of coagulation, washing, drying, and possibly finishing.

• The present invention provides a sewing machine detector with a thinner and more compact detecting section, minimizing stress on optical fibers and eliminating interference with power indicating lights.
• The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that detect sewing machine speed, needle positions, and thread trimmer timing, with light transmitted between first and second reflecting portions and received by light receiving optical fibers.
• Key features include:
  • Coaxially mounted, unrotatably secured first light shielding disc and rotatably mounted second and third discs.
  • Integrally secured and fixed light sending and receiving optical fibers and reflecting portions by the optical fiber supporter.
  • Linear optical fiber fixing holes for locking fiber ends without flexing, reducing stress and improving efficiency.
  • Power indicating optical fiber runs from module section to detecting section without interference.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
- The device includes control means, a stop, and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop.
- The stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member, which is part of the control means, and can be retracted from the feed path of the strip.
- The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter for starting the retraction of the stop, the lowering of the presser foot, and the starting of the sewing machine.
- The stop is mounted for being displaced by a setting means, such as an air cylinder, and substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece.
- The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
- The device ensures a continuous operation, makes it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.

</summary>

- The invention is a sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece.
- It includes a guide chute for a strip of add on material, a stop in the feed path of the strip, and control means for adjusting the position of the stop and controlling the operation of the sewing machine.
- The control means includes a control switch and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop.
- The stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member and can be retracted from the feed path of the strip.
- The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter for starting the retraction of the stop, the lowering of the presser foot, and the starting of the sewing machine.
- The stop is mounted for being displaced by a setting means, such as an air cylinder, and substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece.
- The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
- The device ensures a continuous operation, makes it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.

• The text describes a new composite material concept called BTR (biomimetic tendon-reinforced) composite, which maximizes out-plane stiffness through function-oriented material design (FOMD)
• Key components of the BTR composite include fibers, stuffer members, and joints. The fibers are evenly distributed in the matrix material and optimally arranged along load paths, while the stuffer members and joints enhance structural performance. The concept can be extended to three-dimensional structures and various material variations.

* The present invention provides methods for producing silicon containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning as an illustration.
* Four-component and five-component liquid silane based "ink" compositions are produced and characterized to demonstrate the compositions and methods.
* The resulting nanowires can be used as a component of other material compositions such as an anode material for a lithium ion battery.

* Three-component ink, Si 6 H 12 /PMMA, was used to demonstrate the electrospinning methods and thermolysis products without the accelerant.
* Si 6 H 12 undergoes ring opening polymerization under heat or prolonged exposure to laser light with additional thermal treatment transforming the solid polydihydrosilane into amorphous silicon first and then crystalline silicon material.
* The deposit can also be transformed using laser processing to produce crystalline silicon-containing materials.

* Five-component ink, Si 6 H 12 /PMMA/solid phase, was used to demonstrate an alternative solvent and to characterize performance of the resulting material as an electrode.
* The solid phase component may be a metallic particle, graphite, carbon black, or graphene, and can also be a photoactive solid phase or a reactive compound.
* The fibers are transformed to amorphous silicon or crystalline silicon composites through thermal treatment or light activation via radical polymerization.
* An optional coherent, conductive coating may be applied to the transformed materials before or after the thermal treatments.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a flexible traction element and a production line for embedding stranded cables in a thermoplastic material.
  * Flexible traction element: made of stranded cables sheathed in thermoplastic material for increased flexibility and improved adhesion.
  * Production line: includes a reel for unwinding stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.

- The stranded cables consist of a core strand and peripheral strand cords, which are made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength and can be coated with thermoplastic material prior to applying peripheral strand cords.
  * Core strand: sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer for increased flexibility and better adhesion.
  * Peripheral strand cords: made of individual fibers or wires and stranded around the core strand.

- The production line ensures precise control of the spacing and positioning of the stranded cables, which guarantees tensile strength and improves the overall quality of the traction element.
  * Precise orientation: achieved by a device that ensures the stranded cables lie on one plane, allowing for uniform spacing between the stranded cables and the jacket.
  * Pressure rollers: used to correct the position of the stranded cables in the still soft plastics material, ensuring they are positioned accurately in the jacket.

- The method for embedding stranded cables in a thermoplastic material involves unwinding the stranded cables, degreasing or pre-treating them to improve adhesion, preheating to a temperature near the melting temperature, and sheathing them in the liquefied thermoplastic material using an extruder.
  * Degreasing or pre-treatment: ensures good adhesion between the stranded cables and the thermoplastic material jacket.
  * Preheating: improves the adhesion between the stranded cables and the thermoplastic material by removing residual gases and improving the surface temperature.

* The present invention provides a bedroom cabinet with flat external surfaces and internal shelves and boxes without projection.
* It achieves this by using an outer casing and an inner casing with a clearance between them, allowing for the formation of boxes or shelves without reducing the dwelling area or deteriorating the external appearance.
** Mechanical strength is improved by the dual construction of the outer and inner casings.
** Boxes for electric devices or shelves can be formed in the clearance, and wirings or the like for interior electric devices can be housed in the clearance.
* The invention also provides for a clearance between the outer casing and inner casing over the whole periphery, with spacer members interposed to increase uniform air flowpassage and sound-proofing effect.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine.
- Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted with a boundary between them using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
- When both pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed and overlaid with the loop of the fixed side knit fabric.
- A new loop is formed on the overlaid part, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric.
- This process is repeated until the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined.
- The new loop, a part of the loop of the adjoining moving side knit fabric, and a part of the loop of the fixed side knit fabric are overlaid and another loop is formed, decreasing one more loop in the moving side fabric.
- By repeating this sequence, the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined and the final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening.
- The knitting machine used is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds laid out in a V-form, with the rear one being movable in the lateral direction.
- The knitting process is controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern.
- The invention can be applied to various parts linking tape- or rope-shaped portions, such as the collar part of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope portion of an apron.

</summary>

* The text describes a small deaeration tank system for pulp treated with oxygen before washing
* The tank is designed to be at atmospheric pressure or under low pressure/vacuum, and has no moving parts
* The deaerator is a cylindrical tank with an open top and flat bottom, and the same diameter as the oxygen reactor
* The inlet pipe allows pulp to enter above the surface of the slurry and splash against the side wall
* The outlet is located in the bottom plate and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank, with recycled filtrate added
* The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a height sensor, which operates the valve between the deaeration tank and the washer
** Design features:
* Diameter: same size as oxygen reactor or 0.75-1.5 times larger
* Exterior height: prevents spilling over sides based on pulp slurry consistency
* Nominal height of slurry: 0.8D (hydrostatic head or manometer measurement)
* Inlet pipe: center line between upper surface of slurry and top edge of tank, extends across tank
* Outlet: located in bottom plate, outside diameter between 0.12 and 0.2D, center line in same vertical plane as inlet line, flange attaches to a flange on line 32.

<summary>

- The present invention is about an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
- Each spool holder has a controller with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive, braking element coupled to it.
- The controllers are simultaneously settable by fluid pressure and each is connected to a different corresponding spool holder.
- A biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, is connected to each tensioning lever.
- The force generated by the biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, altering thread tension.
- The entire thread tension can be centrally set, and the biasing arrangement allows for quick braking when the warping machine is shut off.

</summary>

- Each spool holder has a fluid pressure sensitive biasing arrangement that influences the tensioning lever.
- The fluid pressure is controllable in common for all the biasing arrangements.
- The force generated by the biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, altering thread tension.
- The entire thread tension can be centrally set.
- The biasing arrangement allows for quick braking when the warping machine is shut off.
- The biasing arrangement is formed by a piston/cylinder assembly that can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever and prevent contamination of the threads.
- The tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe is removed from contact with the further braking surface on restart of the warping machine, preventing locking.
- The braking shoe can be held by the tensioning lever for a simple mode of construction with few additional parts.
- The brake rotor can be a brake drum with a braking band or a braking disc of electro-conductive material with a magnetic system.
- The magnetic system can comprise a permanent magnet adjacent one of a pair of legs straddling the braking disc.
- The magnetic system brakes by generating eddy currents in the braking disc.
- The more the disc is covered by the system, the greater the braking effect.
- By activating the biasing arrangements of all the braking arrangements, the thread tension can be globally altered.
- Pressing the brake shoe to the brake drum causes a rapid braking.

* The text describes a system and method for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element using a splice and a grid-strip.
* The splice couples the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip together, allowing them to function as a single composite soil reinforcing element.
* The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions that seat the transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip, and perforations for securing the plates together with a connective device.
** Wave plates:
* Define one or more transverse protrusions for receiving and seating transverse wires
* May be mirror images of each other
* Each plate may include one or more plate perforations
** Connective device:
* Extensible through the perforations in the wave plates
* Secures the first wave plate to the second wave plate
* Prevents longitudinal escape of transverse wires once nuts are tightened onto the bolts.

* The invention provides a new and improved safe and door structure with a readily assembled, low cost design.
* Features include:
  * A safe with a valuables receiving chamber and a rectangular opening, having inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for a plateshaped separate steel door placement.
  * Grooves formed on opposite walls transverse to the first set of opposing walls, providing stops for retaining the door and allowing for slight angle insertion and pivoting towards the ledge.
  * A lock assembly on the reverse side of the door with a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar and reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt for prevention of lateral movement and force transmission in case of intrusion attempts.
  * Optional embodiments include grooves formed by elongate bar members or within the walls themselves.

* The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using it for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR).
* Pulsed power is a rapid release of electrical energy stored in capacitor banks, which can be harnessed in various industrial applications.
* The invention uses pulsed power in both electrohydraulic (EH) and electromagnetic (EM) modes for EOR.
* In the EH mode, a plasma channel is created by a spark gap submerged in water, generating high pressures and temperatures that can be used for geophysical exploration, mining, and oil recovery.
* In the EM mode, a coil is designed to produce controlled flux compression, which can be used to generate various physical effects without the coupled effect of the EH strong acoustic wave.
* The invention addresses the limitation of direct acoustic stimulation by using wide band vibrations at greater distances through pulsed power.
* The invention also recognizes the importance of higher frequencies for effective stimulation and the role of acoustic absorption by scale-dependent features in reservoirs.
* The present invention uses a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations for effective mobilization of oil and increasing production.
* The invention also includes improvements in the design of the tool, such as multiple-level tools, single-turn coil EM discharge devices, and hollow EH electrodes with improved feeding devices and gas-injection devices.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can plastically deform during a dynamic event to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage.
• The load-limiting device may be easily attached to a brace in a braced frame using a connection means and may have biaxial support for the frame.
• The device may be made of a plastic or metal-based elasto-plastic material and can undergo plastic deformation when subjected to high loads, forming hinged mechanisms to dissipate energy. It can be removed and replaced with an un-deformed device after plastic deformation.
</summary>

• The load-limiting device is designed for use in braced frames and is attached to a brace using a connection means.
  • The device provides biaxial support for the braced frame and can dissipate energy when high lateral loads are placed on the frame.
  • The load-limiting device is able to plastically deform in response to a load and may have elasto-plastic properties to allow for the formation of a plastic hinge mechanism.

• The load-limiting device is made of a plastic or metal-based elasto-plastic material.
  • It can withstand small loads without plastic deformation based on elasto-plastic properties.
  • When subjected to high loads, the device may yield to form hinged mechanisms to dissipate energy from the braced frame structure during a dynamic event.

• The load-limiting device may be removed from the braced frame structure after a dynamic event wherein it has undergone plastic deformation.
  • A new un-deformed load-limiting device may be inserted into the braced frame structure to replace a plastically deformed device.
  • The device may be easily removed and replaced with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device.

* The present invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passageway and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes.
* The blade consists of a blade, leading edge sections, point, and a fluid tube. The fluid tube transfers pressurized fluid from the top of the plow into the blade, and the location and length of stitch welds define the location and volume of fluid ejection.
** The fluid tube terminates near the bottom of the critical high friction area to maximize fluid volume and pressure.
** The number and location of leading edge sections and stitch welds can be adjusted to match specific job requirements.
* In another embodiment, a manifold is installed between the blade and leading edge sections, allowing fluid to be routed from the tube to nozzles installed at the rear side of the manifold.
** Varying the nozzles utilized allows control of flow rates and location of fluid injection.
** The plow can be modified using hand tools without welding.
* In another preferred embodiment, the fluid tube is located on the opposite side of the blade, protected by plates.
** The tube is sealed to the bottom end section and blade, forcing the fluid into a void that intersects with the fluid void at the bottom-front corner of the blade.
** The fluid can then travel to the edge of the blade and out to the soil through gaps and spaces between stitch welds or through a manifold between the front edge sections and the blade.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in constructing safety barriers or fences at sites under construction.
• Modern construction techniques require safety barriers with personal safety and retaining kick boards for floor level.
• Traditional methods use lumber, which are time-consuming, labor-intensive, and not always reusable.
• Proposed structures are often impractical, expensive, or too complicated for efficient use.
• A need exists for a simple, portable guard rail system that meets safety guidelines and can be assembled and disassembled efficiently.

• Guard rail support consists of a base plate, upright column, rail supporting brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring.
• Base plate is flat, rectangular, and has bores for fastening to floor or ground surface.
• Upright column is affixed to base plate and has L-shaped rail supporting brackets and a retaining flange.
• Rail supporting brackets and retaining flange are dimensioned to accommodate wooden rails and kick boards.
• Angular brace provides structural stability, and safety tie-off ring serves as attachment point for safety cables or weatherproof tarpaulins.

• Concrete-filled steel base is optional for anchoring guard rail support to floor or ground surface when not possible.
• Steel base has a groove for slidably receiving base plate, and channels for receiving angular brace, retaining flange, and kick board rails.
• Guard rail assembly is constructed by securing guard rail supports to floor, positioning and securing wooden rails and kick boards within brackets, and securing adjacent supports with overlapping rails or short stubs.
• The all-steel construction ensures durability and repeated use for many years, providing a high return on investment and cost savings.
• The guard rail support and assembly can be used in various situations, such as around roof structures, bridge construction, or any drop-off edge.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a floor transport system for use in a fluid treatment chamber to prevent contamination of the treatment fluid by truck wheels.
- Enclosed floor track system includes a wheel channel with a cover plate and support legs to keep showered fluid out.
- In one embodiment, the wheel channel has a hinged cover plate for easy cleaning and a drip edge to prevent liquid entry.
- In another embodiment, the enclosed floor track system uses inflatable elastomer seals to prevent brine solution entry around hand truck wheel struts.
- The floor tracks are pitched to drain away liquid and are supported above the chamber floor to maintain a sanitary environment.
- The enclosed floor track system enhances brine solution recovery and reuse, preserving natural resources and achieving economic advantages.

</summary>

• Improvements include:
  • Designing heating units to prevent invasion by down hole fluids and protect electrical connections.
  • Containing heat within the production zone to promote flow to the well bore.

• The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems
• Embodiments accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths, isolated to pressures produced by the formation
• Pressure sensing apparatus inlet located at desired depth, isolated from pressures above and below
• First embodiment: permanent downhole pressure transducer, cemented in borehole, filter used to clear cement grout and form fluid connection
• Second embodiment: hydrofracture stage, transducer not connected to bottom end of fluid injection tube, filter connected to bottom of tube, cement grout confines inlet to formation pressures
• Third embodiment: grout pipe installed in borehole, filter connected to bottom of fluid injection tube, cement grout pumped to fill borehole, fluid pumped to clear filter and displace cement grout, hardened cement grout functions to concentrate pressurized fluid in annular area around filter
</summary>

• Embodiment 1: Permanent downhole pressure transducer
  • Pressure transducer located at desired depth in borehole
  • Cemented in borehole with filter and check valve
  • Filter cleared of cement grout, cement grout displaced to form fluid connection

• Embodiment 2: Hydrofracture stage
  • Filter connected to bottom of fluid injection tube
  • Cement grout pumped to fill borehole
  • Fluid pumped to clear filter and displace cement grout, hardened cement grout confines inlet to formation pressures

• Embodiment 3: Grout pipe installed in borehole
  • Filter connected to bottom of fluid injection tube
  • Cement grout pumped to fill borehole
  • Fluid pumped to clear filter and displace cement grout, hardened cement grout functions to concentrate pressurized fluid in annular area around filter

* The present invention provides a wear bushing retriever apparatus that allows vertical movement of the retrieving unit while allowing rotational movement during operation.
* The apparatus comprises a sub-unit with a mandrel, a threadably removable lower collar, and a retriever section with protruding members for engaging an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
* The retriever section is slidably engaged into the double grooved mandrel portion of the sub-unit and prevented from rotational movement by insertion members in the grooves.
* The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole and is easily removable and installable for quick wear bushing removal during drilling operations.
* An additional embodiment of the retriever unit includes a threaded lower end section for retrieving wear bushings with threaded collar sections.

• Vibratory tool for downhole use allows wireline passage and is activated by dropping a plug
• Annular dump valve keeps middle of tool free for wireline access and eliminates slamming against a seat
• Modular stacked pistons increase power delivery and eliminate impact on housing
• Tool can operate with or without impacts, depending on overpull force
• Design features include a rotational lock for torque transmission and elimination of significant cyclical impacts
</summary>

• Vibratory tool:
  o Allows wireline passage through a central passage
  o Activated by dropping a plug into passage

• Annular dump valve:
  o Keeps middle of tool free for wireline access
  o Eliminates slamming against a seat by using a ring seal that slides between surfaces

• Modular stacked pistons:
  o Increase power delivery by exposing more piston area to applied pressure
  o Eliminate impact on housing by controlling overpull force

• Design features:
  o Rotational lock for torque transmission
  o Elimination of significant cyclical impacts by using a cylindrically shaped valve and beefy spring.

• Precast concrete retaining wall with integral counterfort and base, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases
• Uses pre-manufactured parts for installation, reducing costs and eliminating the need for temporary shoring

• Precast concrete face panel with integral counterfort, extending perpendicularly from the face and having an opening for drainage
• Counterfort has a flat bottom, extends rearward, and has rebars for tension and resistance to tensile forces

• Precast concrete base, rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform, set on grade and having openings for rebar connections
• Base can have a shear key for connection to the face panel and can be precast with a front lip or have openings for grout fill

• Connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting rebar into openings and filling with grout
• Installation involves aligning and lowering the face panel onto the base, using shims for adjustment and grout for connection

• Additional features include H-piles for added stability, vehicle impact barriers cast-in-place or pre-manufactured, and flexibility between adjacent walls.

• The text describes a problem with conventional composed stave floors or engineering floors, specifically the thin sight substrate which tends to deform and detach upon sanding or maintenance.
• The proposed solution involves using a thicker sight substrate (at least 4 mm) and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, glue, clamps, and cemented clamps, to prevent displacement or change of dimensions.
• The use of these holding means allows for increased durability and the ability to provide corrective maintenance, resulting in floors with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, and a method of mounting an elastic member therein.
- It is designed for applications in new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
- The structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends, more than one elastic member mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
- The joint block blocks up the expansion gap while permitting an expansion gap function to be maintained, preventing tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for smooth and safe vehicle traveling.
- The elastic members are of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally, and are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like for easy maintenance.
- The use of a joint block, supporting blocks, and intermediate joint blocks of the same concrete quality as the traveling path or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete eliminates the need for difference-in-level management and ensures increased slip resistance to tires.

</summary>

* The present invention addresses instability and contact area issues with ladders.
* It provides a brace for ladders with large contact areas and improved lateral stability.
* The brace includes an extension arm with a flange and U-bolt for securing to the ladder rung.
* A resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the extension arm for non-damaging contact with the work surface.

* Objective 1: Increase contact area of ladder with work surface without damaging it.
* Objective 2: Improve lateral stability of ladder.
* Objective 3: Allow ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.
* Solution: Large contact area brace assembly with extension arm, flange, U-bolt, and resilient pad assembly.

* The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine's boom from being tilted by its own weight.
* The lock device includes an engaging member and an engaged member, allowing for manual locking.
* The engaging member is provided on the boom or a boom bracket, and the engaged member is provided on the other end of the boom or the boom bracket.
* The engaged member can be released from the hook part of the engaging member, allowing either the first or second surface of the engaging member to touch the guide member. When engaged, the second surface touches the guide member.
* The guide member is provided on the boom and does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated between its highest and lowest positions.
* An end surface of the engaging member is enabled to touch the engaged member and is slanted toward the lengthwise center of the engaging member.
* A slip-prevention plate is fixed to the tip of the support pin and the support pin can be inserted into the slot through the slip-prevention plate at a prescribed angle.
* A member supporting the engaging member is projected from the boom bracket and the guide member is formed integrally with the boom bracket.
* The engaging member is provided with upper and lower guide members that slidably touch the upper and lower surfaces of the other side of the engaging member.

Effects:
* The lock device is constructed easily and allows for the engaging member to be held in the lock position or the lock release position by sliding along the slot and touching the guide member with either the first or second surface.
* The engaging member maintains the lock position at any rotation position of the boom between the highest and lowest positions, eliminating the need for a holding mechanism and simplifying the lock device.
* The engaging member can evade the engaged member and prevent damage when the boom is rotated to the lock position and the engaging member moves to the lock side.
* The slip-prevention mechanism is constructed easily and does not require any slip-prevention member separately, reducing the number of parts and assembly processes.
* The engaging member is guided at its upper and lower sides, stabilizing the guide of the engaging member and preventing ricketiness.
* Force applied on the guide member is dispersed into two, allowing the guide member to be constructed small and prolonging the life of the lock mechanism.

• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform having a central, vacuum portion adjustable relative to the pool bottom for precise suction regulation.
• Several types of pool cleaning devices have been suggested, including those with a suction head connected to a flexible suction line and moved manually across the pool bottom.
• A drawback of these devices is the lack of a simple way to regulate suction during the cleaning operation.
• The invention provides adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head to precisely regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central, suction portion and the pool bottom.
• Devices with separately adjustable roller positions, such as U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,402,101 and 4,637,086, have difficult and time-consuming adjustments.
• The adjustment means of the present invention can be added to existing devices with minor changes.
• The apparatus comprises a platform with a central, cylindrical member, a handle assembly, and outboard and inboard roller assemblies.
• The inboard roller assemblies have a specially configured frame member connected to the platform, which houses the adjustment means.
• The adjustment means includes an elongated connector, a threaded shank, a wing nut, and a coil spring.
• The roller height adjustment device, in kit form, can be used with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies for precise regulation of suction.
</summary>

- The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, specifically improving connection and disconnection of pull tools from down hole objects.
- Background: During drilling and well servicing operations, objects may become lost or stuck in well bores, referred to as "fish." Pull tools are used to establish connection and remove these objects.
- Many types of pull tools and grappling devices have been developed, with wire line operations commonly used for introducing pull tools into well bores.
- API Standard fishing necks are commonly used on down hole devices, but can wear down, leaving only a stub pipe without the usual undercut shoulder.
- Overshot type retrieving tools are used to connect to worn fishing necks, but disconnection can be difficult if the pulling tool is unable to effectively pull the object.
- It is desirable to provide down hole service equipment that effectively connects and disconnects from down hole objects, reducing the need for violent mechanical movements that can cause damage.

* Mechanism:
  * External pull tool or overshot: Adapted for use in well servicing operations, runs into the well casing or well bore for establishing mechanical connection with an object.
  * Internal pull tool or spear: Depending on the service operation, functions similarly to the external pull tool but is located inside the well bore.
- The tool structure consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves inside it. Telescoping movement causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object.
- A catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position secures the inner and outer body structures together. A control spring ensures the pin alternately enters one or the other of the unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly.
- The tool can be locked or unlocked simply by downward or upward movement of the control line tool, allowing for efficient selective control during service operations.
</summary>

• The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and effectively burns wet wood of 70% moisture content.
• The burner features a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel. Swirl air is introduced tangentially to maintain a steady temperature and force particulate out of the gas stream.
• The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber and then fully combusted in a secondary chamber with secondary air introduced tangentially. The flame holder serves as a barrier against particulate while allowing gases to pass through. Adjustable tuyeres allow for individual control of air and velocity introduced into the primary and secondary chambers.

- The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, specifically for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston.
- Valve action in internal combustion engines is required for four functions: intake, compression, combustion, and exhaust. Proper timing for opening and closing valves is critical for efficient and effective power generation.
- Standard method of controlling valves is through a timing belt that connects the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, with cams incapable of closing port openings and requiring springs for closure.
- The invention aims to significantly reduce gas consumption by efficiently and effectively controlling valve port openness, allowing for precise and timely control of engine performance.
- The valve actuation system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which converts reciprocating linear motion into a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion for the valve.
- The valve itself is attached to a slide, which reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement. The up and down movement of the valve is dependent on the angle the slot makes with the line of action of the first translating means.
- The cam groove curvatures are designed to provide proper rise and fall along with dwell time in concert with the engine.
- The invention allows for computer control of each valve, enabling operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement for improved fuel economy and engine performance.

</summary>

* The present invention is an efficient apparatus for cooling air through evaporative refrigeration, using a heat exchanger to keep evaporating water separate from the cooling air stream.
* Key features include drawing at least a major portion of working air from the room to be cooled, using a heat exchange assembly to pre-cool fresh air, and separating and recycling moisture-laden return air.
* A specific embodiment utilizes an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with fresh air passing through the dry side and return air through the wet side for evaporation.
* Other variations include recirculating return air with fresh air for faster cooling, bypassing cooled air to the return air blower compartment for lower useful air temperature, and using a composite, hybrid system with a vapor compression refrigeration unit for additional cooling and dehumidification.

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines.
* The invention aims to address the disadvantages of prior art flow deflection apparatuses, such as complex casting, difficulty in cooling the transitional region, thermal stresses, high blade weight, and increased casting development.
* The solution is to construct the separating walls, which bound the cooling channels, as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured.
* Advantages of using inserts include simpler cooling system adjustment, no thermal stresses or large amounts of material in the transitional region, reduced blade weight, and simpler casting.

Indentation level 1:
* Separating walls are produced as separate inserts instead of being cast together with the apparatus.
* Inserts are secured in place using holders, which can be integrally formed in the interior of the flow deflection apparatus or connected by an integral material joint.

Indentation level 2:
* Holders simplify assembly and attachment of the inserts and ensure a good seal at the edges.
* Separating walls can be flat strips made of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials.
* Inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape to deflect cooling fluid into adjacent channels.
* Inserts can be secured on one or both sides, in the blade tip region or blade root region.
* Separating walls can be provided when blades are produced or inserted as a substitute for cast separating walls.

• The present invention relates to a collated fastener assembly and method for making it, which includes a row of fasteners arranged parallel to each other and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
• The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer and is preheated before molding to enhance adhesion. The collation system reduces debris generation during driving, increases holding power in wood, and prevents corrugation.
• • Preheating the nails prior to molding the plastic collation enhances adhesion and increases the withdrawal strength of the nails in wood.
• • The collar portion has a greater longitudinal length at the midpoint between connecting elements and a taper at the collar portion closest to the tip of the nail, which facilitates penetration into the wood.
• • The connecting portion includes a bridge that extends between adjacent collar portions and a rib that runs along the bridge. The rib has a low profile in the nail axial direction and a greater depth or width than the bridge.
• • A notch can be formed at the base of the connecting portion along a desired line of separation to influence or encourage separation at a desired location.
• • The upper and lower collations have essentially equal dimensions, with the collar having a length of about 0.360 inches to 0.480 inches and a thickness of about 0.005 inches to 0.015 inches, and the bridge having a length of about 0.280 inches to 0.420 inches and a thickness of about 0.006 inches to 0.014 inches.
• • The collar can be formed with a taper or thinned region closest to the tip of the nail to facilitate penetration into the wood.
• • The plastic collation can be used with coiled nail collations, with a bridge connecting the collar portions but no rib used to allow for flexing of the collations.
• • The amount of debris generated when the nail is driven from the strip is reduced when the nail connecting portion is separated as close as possible to the next trailing nail.
• • The strip can be configured with a weakened region

* The present invention is a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals for accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and uses these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor, setting the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
* The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, allowing for manual control of the throttle valve when desired. This prevents the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling when switching from automatic to manual control.
* The system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, automatically switching to the optimum control mode for the throttle based on the transmission ratio.
* The microprocessor in the control unit can generate pulses for driving a stepper motor using a subroutine, or control a DC motor through an analog converter.
* To switch from automatic to manual control, clutch 11 is engaged and power is removed from the motor, allowing throttle valve 4 to move toward a closed position. Once the throttle position matches the accelerator pedal position, clutch 11 is disengaged and the switch is complete.
* To switch from manual to automatic control when the throttle valve is driven by a DC motor, electrical power is provided to the motor and clutch 11 is disengaged.
* To switch from manual to automatic control when the throttle valve is driven by a stepper motor, clutch 11 is disengaged and the stepper motor is provided with electrical power after a wait loop.

* The present invention relates to position and motion sensors for mechanical systems.
* Many mechanical systems contain moving parts whose position, timing, or speed must be monitored and controlled.
* Two-wire current output position sensors are commonly used to reduce wiring requirements.
* These sensors generate electrical signals proportional to the distance between a moving object and a fixed position.
* However, they also generate unwanted electrical signals or noise.
* Higher frequency noise can be filtered out using a low pass filter.
* Lower frequency noise, such as DC offset or error signals, can be eliminated using a sensor signal conditioner.
* The conditioner includes a waveform generator, an error correction generator, and a window reference circuit.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not deliver position information.
* The window reference circuit constantly compares the sensor output to a desired conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts it if necessary.

</summary>

* The invention provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy required.
* The position sensor includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator.
* The waveform generator modifies the unconditioned sensing signal in response to an error correction signal for providing a conditioned sensing signal.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals.
* It uses a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit for constantly comparing the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value.
* The window reference circuit constantly compares the desired conditioned sensor signal output to the existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts it if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
* The signal processor generates a relatively small reference signal for eliminating small values of drift and a relatively large reference signal for rapid recalibration.
* The DAC and counter combination circuit contains enough resolution such that even if a sensor offset correction signal is generated, the error correction signal is not a significant portion of the conditioned sensing signal.
* The sensor draws a minimum of current upon power-up and can be recalibrated at any time by external means.
* The sensor generates a relatively small reference signal for eliminating small values of drift and a relatively large reference signal for rapid recalibration.

* The text discusses the issues with in-line spark plug arrangements in rotary engines and the negative impact on cooling performance.
* The invention proposes staggered spark plug boss arrangements to improve cooling flow and reduce thermal distortion.
* The staggered arrangement promotes relatively close in-line arrangement of spark plug terminals, has a predetermined offset to allow for propagation of the combustion flame, and uses flow diverters or controllers for controlled flow regime between the bosses.

* The present invention provides a point cap system and a balance pin for archery equipment, improving upon the prior art by reducing stress on arrow shafts and preventing dirt entry.
* Point cap system includes a small, lightweight point cap and a balance pin of adjustable weight, allowing perfect balance and reducing material and weight of points.
	+ Point cap is an integral, one-piece unit with external threads and a hollow interior, reducing stress on graphite shafts and providing additional support.
	+ Balance pin can be adjusted to balance arrow shafts and is attached to the point cap, ensuring exact point weight and perfect balance.
* Means for attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt entry are provided, as well as a point adaptor and a nock cap adaptor.
	+ Point adaptor is an integral, one-piece unit with internal threads for threaded receipt of various types of arrow points and a hollow cylindrical bore for arrow shaft receipt.
	+ Nock cap is a hollow cylindrical end for slidable receipt on the arrow shaft and a hollow tapered end for insertion into a nock bore, providing fluid communication and allowing air escape upon insertion.

• The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military small arms training.
• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.
• The invention produces sound and flash by electrical ignition in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and ensures safety precautions.
• The invention aims for realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, cost-effectiveness, reliability, and safety.

• Electrical control circuit consists of ten functional blocks, including bolt and trigger interfaces, oscillator controls, firing counter, decoder, and control.
• Bolt interface provides realistic simulation of operator actions and ensures safety precautions.
• Trigger interface debounces trigger action and sends signal to oscillator control.
• Oscillator control clocks 500 Hertz oscillator based on bolt actuation and inhibits it when a signal from firing sensor is detected.
• Firing control utilizes thirty-one SCRs and gate resistors to trigger pyrotechnic charges in a controlled manner.
</summary>

• The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance and reduces noise.
• It comprises a tank, two pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a control valve. The smaller pipe opens closer to the air cleaner, reducing noise by acting as a resonator.
• The control valve is actuated by an actuator, which is vacuum-controlled and opens when the engine load condition requires it.
• The tank, larger pipe, and smaller pipe define passages between the tank and intake pipe, respectively. The larger pipe has a cross-sectional area equal to or larger than the intake pipe, while the smaller pipe has a smaller cross-sectional area.
• The ratio of the cross-sectional areas of both pipes is preferably about one tenth. The smaller pipe opens to the air intake passage nearer the air cleaner than the larger pipe.
• The valve operation improves engine performance by creating a new compound curve of the volumetric efficiency curves when the valve is controlled to open and close at specific engine speeds.
• The resonator effect of the tank and narrow passage in the pipe absorbs intake noise, reducing it to permissible levels.
• The position of the smaller pipe adjacent to or near the air cleaner may have a small influence on the dynamic effect.

* The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing.
* It uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valves.
* The method maintains the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet control valves constant, which in turn maintains the steam generator pressure constant and keeps the inlet pressure regulator unaffected.
* The flow difference between the system with all valves and the system with one valve less is determined during design, and the flow demand for the remaining valves is adjusted accordingly to maintain constant total flow.

Sub-points:
* The flow difference between the systems is based on total flow demand and individual valve stem lift.
* The flow demand for the remaining valves is adjusted based on the total flow demand derived from the position of the valve under test and the known difference in flow-lift characteristic between the two systems.

• Invention relates to a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment on various surfaces
• Objectives include simplicity and one-person installation
• Components include a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with tapered springs and integrated hooks and tabs for easy connection
• Adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and temporarily snap-connected to stationary bracket, allowing for easy installation and adjustment

• Adjustable bracket: top surface, side walls with flexible wings and tabs, rotates into locked position on stationary bracket
• Connection: tabs on adjustable bracket engage hooks on stationary bracket, wings pressed inward to release tabs, bracket rotated to desired angle and secured with screws
• Pole mounting: pole mounting brackets attached to stationary bracket, wrapped with chain and secured with wing nuts
• Speaker mounting: speaker bracket attached to adjustable bracket, speaker attached to speaker bracket, adjustable bracket mounted to stationary bracket to form pole-mounted speaker.

- The text describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series, allowing fluid to flow from a reservoir through each pump head and be discharged into a desired location.
- The pump heads have a housing containing an impeller, a drive shaft, and a housing extension. The impeller is mounted on the drive shaft and draws fluid from the housing or the previous pump head.
- The pump heads are connected so that the outlet of one combiner is in direct fluid communication with the inlet of the next housing. The connection may be through a biconical tubular connector that frictionally secures the drive shaft and prevents fluid from entering the drive train.
- The pump may have two or more drive shafts, which may be connected through one or more connectors to allow rotational motion to be transmitted between them. The connectors may be cylindrical or tubular and may extend out from the pump heads or through inlets or combiners.
- The pump may be mounted on a support structure such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, allowing it to be transported and operated at a fluid reservoir.

</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox
• The gearbox is expected to withstand extreme loads, including blade-off events, which can cause major damage and oil leakages
• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening translation
• The pin selectively retains the male and female links
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from translation
• The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to survive extreme loads
</summary>

• The invention relates to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox
  • Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes need to withstand extreme loads, including blade-off events
  • Blade-off events can cause major damage and oil leakages

• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin
  • The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening translation
    • Allows for increased mobility and absorption of extreme shocks
    • Prevents detachment of the gearbox from the engine or transmission of destructive loads
  • The pin selectively retains the male and female links
    • Allows for selective retention and release of the links
    • Can serve as a fusible link that shears under extreme loads

• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from translation
  • Frictional interface between the female and male links
  • Amount of damping determined by coefficient of friction, geometry, and contact areas

• The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link
  • Installed after the male link is disposed within the female link
  • Prevents the mounting link from separating after the pin is sheared

• Use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to survive extreme loads
  • Reduces weight and mass of material required for reinforcement

• The text describes a cooling fan assembly system that eliminates the need for fasteners to secure the fan to a panel.
• The fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and mounting legs with resilient leg portions and spring members.
• The mounting legs have recess portions on the panel that match their shape, allowing the fan assembly to be installed by pressing it against the panel.
• The spring members urge the fan carrier away from the panel once the mounting legs are seated, preventing vibrational forces from causing disengagement.
• The fan assembly can be installed in several stages: load position, partially installed position, and fully installed position, each with different sizes of openings in the panel.
</summary>

• Eliminates fasteners for securing cooling fan assembly to a panel
• Includes motor, fan blade, mounting legs with resilient leg portions and spring members
• Mounting legs have recess portions on panel that match their shape
• Spring members urge fan carrier away from panel once mounted, preventing disengagement
• Installed in several stages: load position, partially installed position, and fully installed position, each with different sizes of openings in the panel.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
• The method includes compressing gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure to obtain further cooling.
• The compressor station includes a compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, control units, and an electronic control system.
• The electronic control system compresses gas to an excess pressure, expands it to the desired exit pressure, and recovers mechanical energy for providing drive energy.
• The compression to excess pressure is carried out in multiple stages, with the majority of compression taking place in two primary compression stages and a booster compressor in the third stage.
• The compressors in the primary compression stages can be completely exchanged for one another, allowing for flexibility in handling changes in pipeline pressure and environmental conditions.
• The invention provides an overall reduction in investment and operation risk compared to conventional methods using re-cooling units.
</summary>

• Present invention: method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline in permanent frost areas

  * Novel and improved oil shear type clutch unit.
  * Utilizes hydraulic fluid for retracting plate actuating means and as a coolant.
- The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, output shaft, clutch plates, clutch discs, and separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.
  * Piston and cylinder means connected to clutch plates on opposite sides of each clutch disc.
  * Fluid pressure control means for simultaneously supplying pressurized fluid in parallel to all piston and cylinder means.

<summary>

- The text discusses the need for vibration reduction techniques for instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM) in spacecraft due to their low damping and susceptibility to high vibration levels.
- Conventional kinematic mounts, such as those shown in FIGS. 2A-2C, have limited success as they provide no provisions to minimize loads transmitted to the instrument.
- The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
- Two preferred embodiments of the damper design are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper.
- The spherical damper uses a spherical shell with a relatively soft layer of viscoelastic (VEM) damping material bonded between two partial shells.
- The cylindrical slot damper uses a series of o-rings placed within slots disposed about the resulting flexural hinges.
- Both dampers induce vibration energy dissipation in the form of heat, preserving the fundamental features of the kinematic mounts.
- The unique frequency-dependent properties of space-qualified VEM make them viable candidates for damping kinematic mounts during flight.
- The proposed mounting concept offers benefits such as simplified design, center-of-gravity mounting, and uncoupling of suspension vibration modes.

</summary>
