* The present invention provides a wear bushing retriever apparatus that allows vertical movement of the retrieving unit while allowing rotational movement during operation.
* The apparatus comprises a sub-unit with a mandrel, a threadably removable lower collar, and a retriever section with protruding members for engaging an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
* The retriever section is slidably engaged into the double grooved mandrel portion of the sub-unit and prevented from rotational movement by insertion members in the grooves.
* The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole and is easily removable and installable for quick wear bushing removal during drilling operations.
* An additional embodiment of the retriever unit includes a threaded lower end section for retrieving wear bushings with threaded collar sections.

<summary>
• Vibratory tool for downhole use allows wireline passage and is activated by dropping a plug
• Annular dump valve keeps middle of tool free for wireline access and eliminates slamming against a seat
• Modular stacked pistons increase power delivery and eliminate impact on housing
• Tool can operate with or without impacts, depending on overpull force
• Design features include a rotational lock for torque transmission and elimination of significant cyclical impacts
</summary>

• Vibratory tool:
  o Allows wireline passage through a central passage
  o Activated by dropping a plug into passage

• Annular dump valve:
  o Keeps middle of tool free for wireline access
  o Eliminates slamming against a seat by using a ring seal that slides between surfaces

• Modular stacked pistons:
  o Increase power delivery by exposing more piston area to applied pressure
  o Eliminate impact on housing by controlling overpull force

• Design features:
  o Rotational lock for torque transmission
  o Elimination of significant cyclical impacts by using a cylindrically shaped valve and beefy spring.

• Precast concrete retaining wall with integral counterfort and base, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases
• Uses pre-manufactured parts for installation, reducing costs and eliminating the need for temporary shoring

• Precast concrete face panel with integral counterfort, extending perpendicularly from the face and having an opening for drainage
• Counterfort has a flat bottom, extends rearward, and has rebars for tension and resistance to tensile forces

• Precast concrete base, rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform, set on grade and having openings for rebar connections
• Base can have a shear key for connection to the face panel and can be precast with a front lip or have openings for grout fill

• Connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting rebar into openings and filling with grout
• Installation involves aligning and lowering the face panel onto the base, using shims for adjustment and grout for connection

• Additional features include H-piles for added stability, vehicle impact barriers cast-in-place or pre-manufactured, and flexibility between adjacent walls.

• The present invention addresses the challenges of effectively heating oil and gas wells to improve production, specifically addressing the issues of improper heat focus and electrical component protection.
• Improvements include:
  • Designing heating units to prevent invasion by down hole fluids and protect electrical connections.
  • Containing heat within the production zone to promote flow to the well bore.
• Key features include:
  • Use of high temperature cement and steel fittings to shield electrical connections.
  • Use of solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation for reliable power delivery.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, specifically improving connection and disconnection of pull tools from down hole objects.
- Background: During drilling and well servicing operations, objects may become lost or stuck in well bores, referred to as "fish." Pull tools are used to establish connection and remove these objects.
- Many types of pull tools and grappling devices have been developed, with wire line operations commonly used for introducing pull tools into well bores.
- API Standard fishing necks are commonly used on down hole devices, but can wear down, leaving only a stub pipe without the usual undercut shoulder.
- Overshot type retrieving tools are used to connect to worn fishing necks, but disconnection can be difficult if the pulling tool is unable to effectively pull the object.
- It is desirable to provide down hole service equipment that effectively connects and disconnects from down hole objects, reducing the need for violent mechanical movements that can cause damage.

* Mechanism:
  * External pull tool or overshot: Adapted for use in well servicing operations, runs into the well casing or well bore for establishing mechanical connection with an object.
  * Internal pull tool or spear: Depending on the service operation, functions similarly to the external pull tool but is located inside the well bore.
- The tool structure consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves inside it. Telescoping movement causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object.
- A catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position secures the inner and outer body structures together. A control spring ensures the pin alternately enters one or the other of the unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly.
- The tool can be locked or unlocked simply by downward or upward movement of the control line tool, allowing for efficient selective control during service operations.
</summary>

• The text describes a problem with conventional composed stave floors or engineering floors, specifically the thin sight substrate which tends to deform and detach upon sanding or maintenance.
• The proposed solution involves using a thicker sight substrate (at least 4 mm) and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, glue, clamps, and cemented clamps, to prevent displacement or change of dimensions.
• The use of these holding means allows for increased durability and the ability to provide corrective maintenance, resulting in floors with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.

* The present invention addresses instability and contact area issues with ladders.
* It provides a brace for ladders with large contact areas and improved lateral stability.
* The brace includes an extension arm with a flange and U-bolt for securing to the ladder rung.
* A resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the extension arm for non-damaging contact with the work surface.

* Objective 1: Increase contact area of ladder with work surface without damaging it.
* Objective 2: Improve lateral stability of ladder.
* Objective 3: Allow ladder to straddle corners without losing stability.
* Solution: Large contact area brace assembly with extension arm, flange, U-bolt, and resilient pad assembly.

• The present invention relates to a collated fastener assembly and method for making it, which includes a row of fasteners arranged parallel to each other and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
• The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer and is preheated before molding to enhance adhesion. The collation system reduces debris generation during driving, increases holding power in wood, and prevents corrugation.
• • Preheating the nails prior to molding the plastic collation enhances adhesion and increases the withdrawal strength of the nails in wood.
• • The collar portion has a greater longitudinal length at the midpoint between connecting elements and a taper at the collar portion closest to the tip of the nail, which facilitates penetration into the wood.
• • The connecting portion includes a bridge that extends between adjacent collar portions and a rib that runs along the bridge. The rib has a low profile in the nail axial direction and a greater depth or width than the bridge.
• • A notch can be formed at the base of the connecting portion along a desired line of separation to influence or encourage separation at a desired location.
• • The upper and lower collations have essentially equal dimensions, with the collar having a length of about 0.360 inches to 0.480 inches and a thickness of about 0.005 inches to 0.015 inches, and the bridge having a length of about 0.280 inches to 0.420 inches and a thickness of about 0.006 inches to 0.014 inches.
• • The collar can be formed with a taper or thinned region closest to the tip of the nail to facilitate penetration into the wood.
• • The plastic collation can be used with coiled nail collations, with a bridge connecting the collar portions but no rib used to allow for flexing of the collations.
• • The amount of debris generated when the nail is driven from the strip is reduced when the nail connecting portion is separated as close as possible to the next trailing nail.
• • The strip can be configured with a weakened region

<summary>

* The present invention relates to position and motion sensors for mechanical systems.
* Many mechanical systems contain moving parts whose position, timing, or speed must be monitored and controlled.
* Two-wire current output position sensors are commonly used to reduce wiring requirements.
* These sensors generate electrical signals proportional to the distance between a moving object and a fixed position.
* However, they also generate unwanted electrical signals or noise.
* Higher frequency noise can be filtered out using a low pass filter.
* Lower frequency noise, such as DC offset or error signals, can be eliminated using a sensor signal conditioner.
* The conditioner includes a waveform generator, an error correction generator, and a window reference circuit.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not deliver position information.
* The window reference circuit constantly compares the sensor output to a desired conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts it if necessary.

</summary>

* The invention provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy required.
* The position sensor includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator.
* The waveform generator modifies the unconditioned sensing signal in response to an error correction signal for providing a conditioned sensing signal.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals.
* It uses a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit for constantly comparing the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value.
* The window reference circuit constantly compares the desired conditioned sensor signal output to the existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts it if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
* The signal processor generates a relatively small reference signal for eliminating small values of drift and a relatively large reference signal for rapid recalibration.
* The DAC and counter combination circuit contains enough resolution such that even if a sensor offset correction signal is generated, the error correction signal is not a significant portion of the conditioned sensing signal.
* The sensor draws a minimum of current upon power-up and can be recalibrated at any time by external means.
* The sensor generates a relatively small reference signal for eliminating small values of drift and a relatively large reference signal for rapid recalibration.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, specifically for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston.
- Valve action in internal combustion engines is required for four functions: intake, compression, combustion, and exhaust. Proper timing for opening and closing valves is critical for efficient and effective power generation.
- Standard method of controlling valves is through a timing belt that connects the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, with cams incapable of closing port openings and requiring springs for closure.
- The invention aims to significantly reduce gas consumption by efficiently and effectively controlling valve port openness, allowing for precise and timely control of engine performance.
- The valve actuation system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which converts reciprocating linear motion into a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion for the valve.
- The valve itself is attached to a slide, which reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement. The up and down movement of the valve is dependent on the angle the slot makes with the line of action of the first translating means.
- The cam groove curvatures are designed to provide proper rise and fall along with dwell time in concert with the engine.
- The invention allows for computer control of each valve, enabling operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement for improved fuel economy and engine performance.

</summary>

• Aquarium lighting using LEDs is the focus of the present invention.
• The invention includes a light member with a housing, a lighting control region, and one or more light-emitting modules.
• The lighting control region has control channels for white and blue light, and a neutral channel.
• The light member includes switches for controlling the white and blue light independently.
• The light-emitting modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and can be positioned anywhere along it.

</summary>

• Light member design:
  • Housing with top and bottom sides, clips for aquarium coupling.
  • Bottom side includes lighting control region with channels for white and blue light, and neutral channel.
  • Switches on housing for controlling white and blue light independently.
  • Single power cord for both channels.

• Light-emitting modules:
  • Releasably coupled to lighting control region.
  • Each module includes four LEDs, electrical connectors, and cover plate.
  • LEDs emit white or blue light, and can be rotated or have optical elements for focusing or diffusing light.
  • Modules can only be installed in one orientation due to connector placement and living hinge design.

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines.
* The invention aims to address the disadvantages of prior art flow deflection apparatuses, such as complex casting, difficulty in cooling the transitional region, thermal stresses, high blade weight, and increased casting development.
* The solution is to construct the separating walls, which bound the cooling channels, as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured.
* Advantages of using inserts include simpler cooling system adjustment, no thermal stresses or large amounts of material in the transitional region, reduced blade weight, and simpler casting.

Indentation level 1:
* Separating walls are produced as separate inserts instead of being cast together with the apparatus.
* Inserts are secured in place using holders, which can be integrally formed in the interior of the flow deflection apparatus or connected by an integral material joint.

Indentation level 2:
* Holders simplify assembly and attachment of the inserts and ensure a good seal at the edges.
* Separating walls can be flat strips made of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials.
* Inserts can be straight or bent into a U-shape to deflect cooling fluid into adjacent channels.
* Inserts can be secured on one or both sides, in the blade tip region or blade root region.
* Separating walls can be provided when blades are produced or inserted as a substitute for cast separating walls.

* The present invention is a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals for accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and uses these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor, setting the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
* The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, allowing for manual control of the throttle valve when desired. This prevents the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling when switching from automatic to manual control.
* The system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, automatically switching to the optimum control mode for the throttle based on the transmission ratio.
* The microprocessor in the control unit can generate pulses for driving a stepper motor using a subroutine, or control a DC motor through an analog converter.
* To switch from automatic to manual control, clutch 11 is engaged and power is removed from the motor, allowing throttle valve 4 to move toward a closed position. Once the throttle position matches the accelerator pedal position, clutch 11 is disengaged and the switch is complete.
* To switch from manual to automatic control when the throttle valve is driven by a DC motor, electrical power is provided to the motor and clutch 11 is disengaged.
* To switch from manual to automatic control when the throttle valve is driven by a stepper motor, clutch 11 is disengaged and the stepper motor is provided with electrical power after a wait loop.

• The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and effectively burns wet wood of 70% moisture content.
• The burner features a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the fuel. Swirl air is introduced tangentially to maintain a steady temperature and force particulate out of the gas stream.
• The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber and then fully combusted in a secondary chamber with secondary air introduced tangentially. The flame holder serves as a barrier against particulate while allowing gases to pass through. Adjustable tuyeres allow for individual control of air and velocity introduced into the primary and secondary chambers.

* The present invention is an efficient apparatus for cooling air through evaporative refrigeration, using a heat exchanger to keep evaporating water separate from the cooling air stream.
* Key features include drawing at least a major portion of working air from the room to be cooled, using a heat exchange assembly to pre-cool fresh air, and separating and recycling moisture-laden return air.
* A specific embodiment utilizes an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with fresh air passing through the dry side and return air through the wet side for evaporation.
* Other variations include recirculating return air with fresh air for faster cooling, bypassing cooled air to the return air blower compartment for lower useful air temperature, and using a composite, hybrid system with a vapor compression refrigeration unit for additional cooling and dehumidification.

<summary>

- The text describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series, allowing fluid to flow from a reservoir through each pump head and be discharged into a desired location.
- The pump heads have a housing containing an impeller, a drive shaft, and a housing extension. The impeller is mounted on the drive shaft and draws fluid from the housing or the previous pump head.
- The pump heads are connected so that the outlet of one combiner is in direct fluid communication with the inlet of the next housing. The connection may be through a biconical tubular connector that frictionally secures the drive shaft and prevents fluid from entering the drive train.
- The pump may have two or more drive shafts, which may be connected through one or more connectors to allow rotational motion to be transmitted between them. The connectors may be cylindrical or tubular and may extend out from the pump heads or through inlets or combiners.
- The pump may be mounted on a support structure such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, allowing it to be transported and operated at a fluid reservoir.

</summary>

  * Each pump head has a housing containing an impeller, a drive shaft, and a housing extension.

  * The connection may be through a biconical tubular connector that frictionally secures the drive shaft and prevents fluid from entering the drive train.

  * The connectors may be cylindrical or tubular and may extend out from the pump heads or through inlets or combiners.

• Engine compression release brake system for engines having less than all engine cylinders equipped with brakes
   • Reduces engine components for improved overall robustness

 • Engine design with modular engine compression release brake system
   • Each cylinder has a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake connected to the exhaust valve
   • Only a portion of cylinders has an engine brake, improving component count and reducing weight

 • Engine operation with engine compression release brakes
   • Determination of engine braking horsepower and selection of cylinders for braking

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox
• The gearbox is expected to withstand extreme loads, including blade-off events, which can cause major damage and oil leakages
• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening translation
• The pin selectively retains the male and female links
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from translation
• The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to survive extreme loads
</summary>

• The invention relates to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox
  • Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes need to withstand extreme loads, including blade-off events
  • Blade-off events can cause major damage and oil leakages

• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin
  • The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening translation
    • Allows for increased mobility and absorption of extreme shocks
    • Prevents detachment of the gearbox from the engine or transmission of destructive loads
  • The pin selectively retains the male and female links
    • Allows for selective retention and release of the links
    • Can serve as a fusible link that shears under extreme loads

• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from translation
  • Frictional interface between the female and male links
  • Amount of damping determined by coefficient of friction, geometry, and contact areas

• The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link
  • Installed after the male link is disposed within the female link
  • Prevents the mounting link from separating after the pin is sheared

• Use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to survive extreme loads
  • Reduces weight and mass of material required for reinforcement

* The present invention provides a point cap system and a balance pin for archery equipment, improving upon the prior art by reducing stress on arrow shafts and preventing dirt entry.
* Point cap system includes a small, lightweight point cap and a balance pin of adjustable weight, allowing perfect balance and reducing material and weight of points.
	+ Point cap is an integral, one-piece unit with external threads and a hollow interior, reducing stress on graphite shafts and providing additional support.
	+ Balance pin can be adjusted to balance arrow shafts and is attached to the point cap, ensuring exact point weight and perfect balance.
* Means for attaching points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt entry are provided, as well as a point adaptor and a nock cap adaptor.
	+ Point adaptor is an integral, one-piece unit with internal threads for threaded receipt of various types of arrow points and a hollow cylindrical bore for arrow shaft receipt.
	+ Nock cap is a hollow cylindrical end for slidable receipt on the arrow shaft and a hollow tapered end for insertion into a nock bore, providing fluid communication and allowing air escape upon insertion.

<summary>
• The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military small arms training.
• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system.
• The invention produces sound and flash by electrical ignition in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and ensures safety precautions.
• The invention aims for realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, cost-effectiveness, reliability, and safety.

• Electrical control circuit consists of ten functional blocks, including bolt and trigger interfaces, oscillator controls, firing counter, decoder, and control.
• Bolt interface provides realistic simulation of operator actions and ensures safety precautions.
• Trigger interface debounces trigger action and sends signal to oscillator control.
• Oscillator control clocks 500 Hertz oscillator based on bolt actuation and inhibits it when a signal from firing sensor is detected.
• Firing control utilizes thirty-one SCRs and gate resistors to trigger pyrotechnic charges in a controlled manner.
</summary>

• The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance and reduces noise.
• It comprises a tank, two pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a control valve. The smaller pipe opens closer to the air cleaner, reducing noise by acting as a resonator.
• The control valve is actuated by an actuator, which is vacuum-controlled and opens when the engine load condition requires it.
• The tank, larger pipe, and smaller pipe define passages between the tank and intake pipe, respectively. The larger pipe has a cross-sectional area equal to or larger than the intake pipe, while the smaller pipe has a smaller cross-sectional area.
• The ratio of the cross-sectional areas of both pipes is preferably about one tenth. The smaller pipe opens to the air intake passage nearer the air cleaner than the larger pipe.
• The valve operation improves engine performance by creating a new compound curve of the volumetric efficiency curves when the valve is controlled to open and close at specific engine speeds.
• The resonator effect of the tank and narrow passage in the pipe absorbs intake noise, reducing it to permissible levels.
• The position of the smaller pipe adjacent to or near the air cleaner may have a small influence on the dynamic effect.

<summary>
• Invention relates to a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment on various surfaces
• Objectives include simplicity and one-person installation
• Components include a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with tapered springs and integrated hooks and tabs for easy connection
• Adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and temporarily snap-connected to stationary bracket, allowing for easy installation and adjustment
• System is suitable for outdoor use, can be used on poles with pole clamp assemblies, and is designed for one-person installation with minimal components
</summary>

• Stationary bracket: flat rear panel, side walls with hooks and apertures, mounting holes, and slits for pole mounting
• Adjustable bracket: top surface, side walls with flexible wings and tabs, rotates into locked position on stationary bracket
• Connection: tabs on adjustable bracket engage hooks on stationary bracket, wings pressed inward to release tabs, bracket rotated to desired angle and secured with screws
• Pole mounting: pole mounting brackets attached to stationary bracket, wrapped with chain and secured with wing nuts
• Speaker mounting: speaker bracket attached to adjustable bracket, speaker attached to speaker bracket, adjustable bracket mounted to stationary bracket to form pole-mounted speaker.

• Burner design for efficient, clean burning with interchangeable heat utilizing appliances

* The text discusses the issues with in-line spark plug arrangements in rotary engines and the negative impact on cooling performance.
* The invention proposes staggered spark plug boss arrangements to improve cooling flow and reduce thermal distortion.
* The staggered arrangement promotes relatively close in-line arrangement of spark plug terminals, has a predetermined offset to allow for propagation of the combustion flame, and uses flow diverters or controllers for controlled flow regime between the bosses.

* The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing.
* It uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valves.
* The method maintains the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet control valves constant, which in turn maintains the steam generator pressure constant and keeps the inlet pressure regulator unaffected.
* The flow difference between the system with all valves and the system with one valve less is determined during design, and the flow demand for the remaining valves is adjusted accordingly to maintain constant total flow.

Sub-points:
* The flow difference between the systems is based on total flow demand and individual valve stem lift.
* The flow demand for the remaining valves is adjusted based on the total flow demand derived from the position of the valve under test and the known difference in flow-lift characteristic between the two systems.

- The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets A and B, and one outlet.
- The outlet mixture comprises a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
- Previously known cleaning apparatuses use valve systems to allow one fluid to intermix with another, providing a solution of predetermined concentration.
- In the commercial airline industry, a stand-alone cleaning apparatus is desired to allow multiple users to control the strength of their cleaning solution.
- The present invention provides a mixing valve with a valve body, two inlet passages, an outlet passage, and a valve means for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage.
- The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to 100% first fluid, 0% second fluid.
- The valve system includes a valve body, a flow restricting device, and a spool valve.
- The spool valve includes a cylindrical portion, a sealing sleeve, a cylindrical portion for receiving a seal carrier, and a series of consecutive cylindrical spools.

</summary>

- The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus.
  * Two inlets A and B.
  * One outlet.
  * Outlet mixture ranges from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
- Previously known cleaning apparatuses use valve systems.
  * Allow one fluid to intermix with another.
  * Provide a solution of predetermined concentration.
- Commercial airline industry requires a stand-alone cleaning apparatus.
  * Multiple users.
  * Complete control over cleaning solution strength.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
• The method includes compressing gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure to obtain further cooling.
• The compressor station includes a compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, control units, and an electronic control system.
• The electronic control system compresses gas to an excess pressure, expands it to the desired exit pressure, and recovers mechanical energy for providing drive energy.
• The compression to excess pressure is carried out in multiple stages, with the majority of compression taking place in two primary compression stages and a booster compressor in the third stage.
• The compressors in the primary compression stages can be completely exchanged for one another, allowing for flexibility in handling changes in pipeline pressure and environmental conditions.
• The invention provides an overall reduction in investment and operation risk compared to conventional methods using re-cooling units.
</summary>

• Present invention: method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline in permanent frost areas
• Method: compress gas to higher pressure, cool, expand to desired exit pressure
• Compressor station: compressor, heat exchanger, pipelines, control units, electronic control system
• Electronic control system: compresses to excess pressure, expands, recovers mechanical energy
• Compression: multiple stages, primary compression stages, booster compressor
• Flexibility: compressors in primary stages can be exchanged
• Advantages: reduction in investment and operation risk

<summary>
• The text describes a cooling fan assembly system that eliminates the need for fasteners to secure the fan to a panel.
• The fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and mounting legs with resilient leg portions and spring members.
• The mounting legs have recess portions on the panel that match their shape, allowing the fan assembly to be installed by pressing it against the panel.
• The spring members urge the fan carrier away from the panel once the mounting legs are seated, preventing vibrational forces from causing disengagement.
• The fan assembly can be installed in several stages: load position, partially installed position, and fully installed position, each with different sizes of openings in the panel.
</summary>

• Includes motor, fan blade, mounting legs with resilient leg portions and spring members

<summary>

- The text discusses the need for vibration reduction techniques for instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM) in spacecraft due to their low damping and susceptibility to high vibration levels.
- Conventional kinematic mounts, such as those shown in FIGS. 2A-2C, have limited success as they provide no provisions to minimize loads transmitted to the instrument.
- The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
- Two preferred embodiments of the damper design are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper.
- The spherical damper uses a spherical shell with a relatively soft layer of viscoelastic (VEM) damping material bonded between two partial shells.
- The cylindrical slot damper uses a series of o-rings placed within slots disposed about the resulting flexural hinges.
- Both dampers induce vibration energy dissipation in the form of heat, preserving the fundamental features of the kinematic mounts.
- The unique frequency-dependent properties of space-qualified VEM make them viable candidates for damping kinematic mounts during flight.
- The proposed mounting concept offers benefits such as simplified design, center-of-gravity mounting, and uncoupling of suspension vibration modes.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a large size clutch unit for an aircraft catapult system, addressing the need for maximum application of forces, cooling requirements, and minimizing residual drag.
  * Novel and improved oil shear type clutch unit.
  * Utilizes hydraulic fluid for retracting plate actuating means and as a coolant.
- The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, output shaft, clutch plates, clutch discs, and separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.
  * Piston and cylinder means connected to clutch plates on opposite sides of each clutch disc.
  * Fluid pressure control means for simultaneously supplying pressurized fluid in parallel to all piston and cylinder means.
- The clutch unit also includes an alternative design with clutch discs comprising a plurality of arcuate segments, allowing for easier fabrication using conventional retort equipment.
  * Each clutch disc segment is held in position by co-acting portions on supporting means and the edges of the clutch disc segments.
  * Removable fastener means for holding supporting means in position, enabling one or more segments to be removed without disturbing others.

* The text describes an engine system that uses expansion cylinders to capture and utilize exhaust heat, reducing the need for a radiator
* The system includes multiple expansion cylinders with increasing displacement and effective surface area, which are heated by the combustion cylinder and help recapture heat energy
* The text also discusses water cooling systems, water recovery systems, and catalytic materials for reducing exhaust emissions.

* Water cooling system:
  * Separate from water injection system
  * Uses a water jacket surrounding the cylinders and a return line to recirculate water

* Water recovery system:
  * Recovers water from the crankcase of the most downstream expansion cylinder
  * Uses a water scrubber to remove exhaust gases and return water to the water tank.

* The present invention provides a method for fabricating plates or blanks of coated steel intended for welding and heat treatment to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance.
* The invention addresses the issue of intermetallic areas forming within welded assemblies, which can lead to reduced deformability and potential rupture.
* To prevent the formation of intermetallic areas, the invention involves removing a precise portion of the metal coating from the periphery of the plate before welding.
* The width of the area from which the metal layer has been removed must be adjusted to enable welding without introducing any element of the precoat into the molten area and to ensure satisfactory corrosion resistance after heat treatment. The width is typically 20% to 40% greater than half the width of the molten area created during welding.

• The present invention is a remote control system and algorithm for a mobile energy recovery system using SCADA technology.
• It optimally recovers energy from an offshore marine environment, accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure.
• The system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, such as GPS systems, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites.
• The servers run HMI secure software applications that communicate with microprocessor systems on the sailing vessel, allowing remote humans to interact and choose mission-critical navigation plans.
• The system is not limited to the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system and can be applied to any mobile structure that extracts energy from weather patterns.
• Essential to the operation of the system is the communication of data from various sources, including GPS, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites.
   • GPS is used to track the position and velocity of the mobile structure.
   • Weather satellites provide weather data to the system.
   • Telecommunications satellites communicate between the central service facility and the mobile structure or between the central service facility and weather data disseminating entities.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing it, using a ring element produced from sheet metal and formed by forming techniques.
* The ring element consists of at least three flat material ring segments joined and welded together in the circumferential direction.
* The joints between the flat material ring segments form engagement zones, where they are connected via positively engaging joint contours.
* The flat material ring segments are cut out as 120° ring segments, requiring only three weld points for joining.
* The ring segments can be welded before or after forming, and the weld points can be formed by laser welding or pressure welding.
* The ring segments can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip, with the circular arc-like inner and outer edges and joint geometries cut out in one step.
* The concept is suitable for manufacturing radial and axial bearing cages, and the ring segments can be welded together during the punching process or before welding.

* The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and processing information related to customer service locations in telecommunications networks, using global satellite positioning to acquire latitude and longitude coordinates.
* The systems include a technician input device, a technician server, a global positioning satellite system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer record system. The methods involve requesting coordinates from the technician, obtaining them using GPS, and updating databases with the coordinates.
* The text also discusses generating directions for a service technician traveling between customer service locations using a mapping system.
* The systems improve customer service response time and efficiency by providing accurate and specific information about customer service locations.

* The text describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit.
* The control unit receives the output signals of the two real sensors, combines them to form output signals of a virtual sensor, and uses these signals as inputs for independent control loops operating in parallel.
* The control loops transform the virtual input signals into changed signals, which are then used to calculate control signals for the six coils. The algorithm used by the control system overall is described as O=L·Ω ( M·S ).
* The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and allows for simulation of measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected.
* The system also aims to equalize potentially arising feedback effects in the case of using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity.
* The text provides a schematic presentation of the system, a block diagram for calculating control signals, and a description of using the magnetic field compensation system and two magnetic field compensation systems directly besides each other.

• The text describes a method for investigating samples using CARS microscopy, with at least one resonance site introduced by a bioorthogonal reaction
• CARS microscopy involves laser irradiation of resonance sites, generating a resonance signal for image production
• The sample can be derived from a biological source and may contain intrinsic resonance sites
• Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes
• The method involves equipping the sample with a bioorthogonal functional group, followed by introduction of a tagging substance with a complementary functional group
• The use of bioorthogonal reactions allows dedicated detection of target sites without negatively affecting biochemical processes
• The invention enables a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in CARS microscopy
• Copper-free click reactions, such as cyclooctynes and azides, are particularly suitable for use in the context of the present invention
• The invention increases the specificity and scattering cross section of CARS microscopy
• Modified Huisgen cycloadditions, nitrone dipolar cycloadditions, norbornene cycloadditions, (4+1) cycloadditions, and oxanorbornadiene cycloadditions are particularly advantageous bioorthogonal reactions
</summary>

• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner

<summary>
• The text describes a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy.
• The system receives segmentations as electronic files and converts them into volume models for comparison.
• The volume models are compared to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements and their distances from the closest common volume element.
• The system uses a metric method to evaluate the quality of the segmentations based on the number and distance of missing and extra volume elements.
• The metric method can be customized by the user through a formula parameter table and graph.
• The system can be used for training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation routines, and assessing new imaging technology.
• The output of the system includes quantitative values such as primary volume, secondary volume, missing volume, extra volume, and metric method/metric score.
• The system can also generate a histogram table to tallies the voxels of the missing and extra volumes according to a distance measurement bin.
• The system can be used to assess whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the internal anatomy of the patient during radiation therapy.
• The system is not limited to the embodiments and illustrations contained in the text and can include modified forms and combinations of elements.
</summary>

• System for assessing segmentations in radiation therapy

• Compares volume models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements and their distances
• Uses metric method to evaluate quality of segmentations based on number and distance of missing and extra volume elements
• Customizable metric method through formula parameter table and graph
• Used for training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation routines, and assessing new imaging technology
• Output includes quantitative values such as primary volume, secondary volume, missing volume, extra volume, and metric method/metric score

- The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes both logic and memory circuits.
- Customized design rules are based on modifying a standard set of Logic Rules to reflect the needs of particular regions in the chip, specifically for memory areas.
- Different types of circuitry (logic, memory) are treated independently to ensure accurate resolution of design rules for a system on chip integrated circuit design.
- The system identifies different types of memory regions and applies distinct and separate design rules to check against violations, eliminating the need for manual checking and false errors.

<summary>
• Invention pertains to using waveguide holograms for controlled illumination of objects, such as holograms and spatial light modulators
• Thin substrate waveguides, characterized by t>λ and t<w, can be used for controlled illumination due to their ability to avoid coupling difficulties and allow for uniform illumination
• Conventional illumination systems require substantial space and can have stability problems, alignment difficulties, and obstruction of other light beams
• Objects like holograms and spatial light modulators require controlled illumination, which can be challenging with conventional methods due to space requirements, need for spectral filtering, and patterned illumination
• WGH illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, providing high diffraction efficiencies
• Non-uniformity of diffracted wavefront can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam or recording the hologram non-uniformly
• WGH illuminators have advantages such as occupying less space, ideal for minimizing stray light, and achieving high diffraction efficiencies
• Challenges with WGH illuminators include alignment requirements, time delay across the hologram, and non-uniformity of diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction
• Solutions to challenges include using a broad source, aligning the source to the waveguide, compensating for illumination depletion a priori or a posteriori, and using a mirror or absorbing paint to deal with two-sidedness
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators, to obtain resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew for identifying defects.
• Objectives include providing a novel, economical, and reliable method and apparatus for non-destructive testing and measurement of rotor properties.
• Prior art methods include using stator cores, destructive testing, and non-destructive techniques with limitations.
• Test apparatus comprises a test head with a core of magnetic material, primary windings, voltage pick-up coils, skew pick-up coils, and a current sensor.
• Analog to digital system includes a sample and hold circuit, phase locked loop, analog multiplexer, and analog to digital converter.
• Data acquisition and processing circuit controls data acquisition and processes data to produce useful test results and rotor pass/fail determinations.
• Control processor determines mean resistance, reactance, effective skew, dissymmetry, and skew dissymmetry from test data.
• Reject signals activate fail indicators for defective rotors, and statistical information is stored for analysis over numerous tests.
</summary>

• Objectives: novel, economical, reliable non-destructive testing and measurement
• Prior art: use of stator cores, destructive testing, non-destructive techniques with limitations

• Analog to digital system: sample and hold circuit, phase locked loop, analog multiplexer, analog to digital converter
• Data acquisition and processing circuit: controls data acquisition, processes data, produces test results, rotor pass/fail determinations
• Control processor: determines mean resistance, reactance, effective skew, dissymmetry, skew dissymmetry from test data

<summary>

- The text describes a method for granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library, while denying access to a managed application that does not have the proper digital certificate.
- The manager, effectuated by native instructions, receives a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library. The manager checks if the managed application is authorized to access the managed library, using information from a digital certificate associated with the managed library.
- The managed library sends a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host, which is effectuated by native instructions, and the runtime host accesses the native system resource.

Additional details:

- The method allows for third party code to execute on a closed mobile device by providing a sandbox or configuring the operating system to segregate third party code from kernel mode code.
- The text also mentions receiving a package from a networked computer system, verifying managed metadata associated with the executable, and storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip.
- The card contains two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
- Smart cards with IC chips and antennas are known, but prior art cards have used rigid cores and complicated methods to secure the antenna and chip.
- The invention provides a unique structure that protects the IC chip and antenna from damage.
- The card consists of a core layer, antenna, chip, bottom sheet, alkyd resin spid, adhesive layers, and polymer layers.
- The core layer is a silica-filled polyolefin, pre-shrunk and printed with indicia and antenna.
- The bottom sheet is also a silica-filled polyolefin, attached to the core layer with an adhesive.
- The alkyd resin spid and antenna are printed on the core layer, and the chip is attached to the antenna.
- The card is then laminated with two transparent polymer layers and a protective layer.

</summary>

* It contains an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip.
* The card has two protective, non-rigid layers for artwork.
* These layers are laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* Smart cards with IC chips and antennas are known, but prior art cards have rigid cores and complicated methods to secure antenna and chip.

<summary>

- The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure.
  * Balanced tree structure is used, ensuring all leaf nodes are at the same level and all nodes are full except for those on the edges.
  * Additions and deletions are made in a specific order to maintain the balance and fill conditions.
- A header node is added in a preferred embodiment, with one child forming the leaf node at the end, one containing the middle part of the queue as a tree, and one forming the leaf node at the beginning.
  * Entire leaf nodes are added or deleted from the tree at once, ensuring all leaf nodes remain at the same level.
  * Updates are faster and less space-consuming due to the constant time required for adding to the header node.
- A bit is added to the header node to indicate which edge is the beginning or end of the queue, allowing for inversion of the queue in constant time and space.
  * Queue can be used as a double-ended queue (deque) with additions and deletions at both ends.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention aims to provide practical methods for manufacturing embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies.
• One objective is to create EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits using existing DRAM technology. Another objective is to manufacture EPROM devices using standard logic technologies without requiring high voltages.
• The invention achieves these objectives through novel device structures that utilize existing circuit elements, such as DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors and transistor properties changed under stress conditions to support EPROM operations.
</summary>

• Use of DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors:
  • Reduces manufacturing complexity and cost
  • Increases gate coupling ratio (GCR) for higher performance and lower voltage requirements
• Utilization of transistor properties changed under stress conditions:
  • Hot carrier effects to build EPROM devices using common transistors
  • Vg stress effects to build SEPROM devices using bipolar transistors or diodes
• Other advantages:
  • Ideal for embedded applications due to low cost and data security
  • Can be manufactured using any IC technologies
  • Provides the possibility to support a wide variety of novel applications.

<summary>

- The text describes a method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains (P, I, and D) used in feedback control systems.
- The method involves executing feedback control using a provisional feedback gain value, detecting an error between the actual and desired values of the controlled system, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating the process with a new feedback gain value until a suitable evaluation value is obtained.
- The evaluation value is calculated based on the length of the curve obtained by plotting the error against time for proportional gain, the integral of the error for integral gain, and the integral of the absolute value of the error for differential gain.
- The method allows for the determination of feedback gains that provide for satisfactory stability, accuracy, and response in a short period of time and regardless of the kind of controlled system.

</summary>

- The method involves executing feedback control using a provisional feedback gain value
  * Detecting an error between the actual and desired values of the controlled system
  * Calculating an evaluation value based on the error
- Repeating the process with a new feedback gain value until a suitable evaluation value is obtained
  * Determining the optimum value of the feedback gain based on the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value
- The evaluation value is calculated based on the length of the curve obtained by plotting the error against time for proportional gain
  * The integral of the error for integral gain
  * The integral of the absolute value of the error for differential gain
- Allows for the determination of feedback gains that provide for satisfactory stability, accuracy, and response
  * In a short period of time
  * Regardless of the kind of controlled system

<summary>

- The invention relates to zoom lenses for photographic and video cameras with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while minimizing size and length.
- There is a demand for zoom lenses with a good compromise between increasing relative aperture and reducing bulk and size in video cameras.
- The use of a 1/2 in. image pickup tube in 8 mm video cameras requires further reduction in size while preserving high grade imagery.
- A 4-unit zoom lens can achieve an increase in relative aperture up to 1.4-1.6 F-number by designing the fourth lens unit and image forming section properly.
- To shorten the total length of the lens system, the effective method is to reduce the bulk and size of the front lens unit, but this may increase spherical aberration, coma, and higher order aberrations.
- The inequalities of conditions (1)-(4) in the text specify the refractive power and curvature of certain lens surfaces to achieve good correction of aberrations and high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
- Condition (1) sets the range of refracting power for the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit to prevent production of various aberrations.
- Condition (2) gives the range of refractive power ratio for the second lens in the fifth lens unit to correct spherical aberration effectively.
- Condition (3) sets the range of refractive power ratio for the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit to correct astigmatism without causing other aberrations.
- Condition (4) gives the range of the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit to correct longitudinal and lateral chromatic aberrations in good balance.
- Condition (5) sets the refractive power of the second lens unit to minimize the variation of aberrations with zooming and reduce the physical length of the entire lens system.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, enabling both individual particle detection and signal integration without knowing signal rates in advance.
- The method involves discharging signals on the low-voltage side of the detector, allowing simpler distinction of small-size signals and preventing leakage currents in high-voltage cables.
- Signals are amplified in a fast amplifier for low rates and integrated in a slow amplifier upon signal rate threshold exceedance.
- Signals are separated by capacitors, high-pass filters, inductive elements, or low-pass filters for proper subdivision during detection.
- Overlapping signal rates in amplifiers enable check and calibration within the signal or count rate range.
- Diamond detector material with fast charge transport at room temperature is proposed for wide signal or count rate detection ranges.
- The invention can be applied in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering.
- A detector can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.

</summary>

- Enables both individual particle detection and signal integration
- Discharges signals on the low-voltage side of the detector
- Simpler distinction of small-size signals and prevention of leakage currents
- Signals amplified in a fast amplifier for low rates and integrated in a slow amplifier upon threshold exceedance
- Signals separated by capacitors, high-pass filters, inductive elements, or low-pass filters
- Overlapping signal rates in amplifiers for check and calibration
- Diamond detector material with fast charge transport at room temperature for wide detection ranges

<summary>
• Invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies
• Apparatus includes an enclosure, stationary and movable rings, a torque motor, and electronic sensors
• Torque motor rotates the driven disc assembly between the rings, measuring the distance between them and detecting warpage
• When warpage is detected, the apparatus generates an external indication to the operator
• Objectives include improving spin checking efficiency, eliminating manual involvement, and providing external test results

• Enclosure has a rigid test structure with a left end plate, right end plate, top plate, and cylindrical shafts
• Rings are mounted on the shafts, allowing sliding movement toward and away from the left end plate

• Support plate is connected to a transfer bar, which extends through the right end plate and is connected to the output shaft of a bi-directional servo motor
• The servo motor rotates the output shaft, moving the rings and transfer bar as a unit, allowing installation and removal of the driven disc assembly

• Torque motor is connected to a spindle within the enclosure, which is splined to an externally splined hub
• The driven disc assembly is installed on the hub and frictionally engaged between the rings when the right ring is moved toward the left

• Microprocessor controls the operation of the torque motor and servo motor, generating signals to a display for the operator
• The basic program includes instructions for reading control switch signals, actuating motors, and generating display signals
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to methods and software for estimating the age of a person from image data using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) and age classification.
- The CAM algorithm extracts facial features that encode age information and distinguishes noise from meaningful signals in a given image.
- The CAM result encodes correlations between the shape and texture models across the training set.
- During the training procedure, feature vectors are extracted from second image data representing face images and used as inputs to an age classifier and two aging functions.
- Support Vector Regression (SVR) is used to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions and an age classifier.
- The goal in SVR is to build a hyper-plane as close to as many of the training points as possible.
- A binary classifier is first built by SVMs to distinguish youths from adults, and then an appropriate aging function is used to determine the age of the face based on the determination of the young/adult classifier.
- Estimated ages may be provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, or as a set of ages with corresponding confidence factors.
- Computing system contains a set of instructions for implementing any one or more of the aspects and methodologies of the present disclosure.
- The CAM algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from the first image data, and the second image data is used to generate aging functions and an age classifier for use in estimating an age of a subject of the first image data.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a matrix display device for merging and displaying two images with different definitions.
- The device consists of a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements, each containing pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and pixels dedicated to displaying the second image.
- The controller produces display light intensity signals for each pixel and applies them based on the corresponding pixels of the first and second images.
- The merged display preserves the definition of the image with higher definition and can be implemented with various arrangements of pixels and color filters.
- The controller can apply attenuation functions to pixels with high intensity signals from the first image to enhance the visibility of the second image.

</summary>

- Consists of a matrix of pixels organized in identical arrangements
- Each arrangement contains pixels dedicated to the first image and pixels dedicated to the second image
- Controller produces display light intensity signals and applies them based on the corresponding pixels
- Merged display preserves definition of image with higher definition

- Various arrangements of pixels and color filters
- Controller applies attenuation functions to enhance visibility of second image
- First image pixels can emit a single color, second image pixels can emit a single color different from the first
- Remaining pixels can display two colors that restore the color associated with the first pixel
- Controller can apply attenuation functions to pixels with high intensity signals from the first image

* Mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, with a payment element and a simple design
* Payment element removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, with a closure for protection and sealing
* Closure movably mounted on the housing, protecting contact elements from the external environment and preventing moisture and dirt particles from penetrating
* Communication means of the identification transmitter can serve for both security system activation and payment system communication, with a range of less than 20 cm and cryptographic security.

* Receptacle has contact elements for the payment element to make contact and be connected to
* In the secure state, the closure protects the contact elements from the external environment, preventing function disruptions and communication interruptions.

<summary>

- The text describes methods and systems for charging toner in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, to maintain consistent image quality after long periods of inactivity.
- The methods involve determining periods of inactivity and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity or the difference between the measured charge of toner and a predetermined level.
- The systems include an inactivity determining section and a charging section, which may be included in a xerographic machine.

</summary>

- Determining periods of inactivity:
  * Monitoring the status of printing operations to identify idle periods.
  * Periodic or continuous monitoring of machine activity.
  * Monitoring at predetermined times of the day.

- Charging toner:
  * Charging to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
  * Charging based on the difference between measured sensor levels.
  * Predicting next user usage and charging accordingly.
  * Updating user usage pattern, predicted next usage, sensor levels, and decay calculations.
  * Storing information for future usage.

• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus for controlling bias currents to MR heads with high precision.
• MR heads require both detecting and bias currents, which are usually combined and transmitted to the rotary drum side.
• The invention provides a structure for independent and precise regulation of bias currents to plural MR heads using a single channel control signal sent from the stationary drum side.
• The bias current control signals are transmitted to a decoder on the rotary drum side, which outputs control signals to the current circuits for the MR heads.
• The decoder discriminates data on bias currents for each MR head and converts digital data into analog D.C. voltage signals, which are then converted into D.C. currents by the current circuits.
• The regenerative amplifier gain and detection of thermal asperity noise can also be controlled independently for each MR head.
• The invention can be applied to other types of apparatuses with plural heads controlled by a recording/regenerative integrated circuit or circuits.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, particularly in the presence of adjacent objects.
• Prior art techniques include passive and active methods for locating buried metallic objects.
• Active technique uses a transmitter and receiver to induce currents and sense magnetic fields associated with the currents in non-ferrous pipes or cables.
• When two adjacent cables are present, the output signal from the receiver becomes distorted, making tracing difficult.
• The invention employs a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable currents in the adjacent objects.
• The receiver senses both magnetic fields and produces an output signal dependent on the presence of both currents.
• Distinguishable currents can be achieved through different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different rates.
• The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between cables is related to their depth.
• The field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance, reducing inducement of currents from both antennae in the same cable and enhancing receiver performance.
</summary>

• Background of the invention: locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, particularly in the presence of adjacent objects
• Prior art techniques: passive (gradiometer) and active (transmitter and receiver) methods for locating buried metallic objects
• Active technique: transmitter induces currents in non-ferrous pipes or cables, receiver senses magnetic fields associated with currents
• Problem: distorted output signal when two adjacent cables are present, making tracing difficult
• Invention: transmitter with pair of antennae induce distinguishable currents in adjacent objects
• Receiver: senses both magnetic fields and produces output signal dependent on presence of both currents
• Distinguishable currents: achieved through different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different rates
• Useful in environments where horizontal separation between cables related to depth
• Performance enhanced by field decreasing by inverse cube of distance, reducing inducement of currents from both antennae in same cable.

<summary>
• Invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network for hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• Includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker device, and a timer for limiting call duration.
• First embodiment uses an optocoupler to detect the telephone ringing signal and connect the speaker phone automatically.
• Second embodiment uses a neon lamp and photocell to detect the ringing signal and connect the speaker phone.
</summary>

• First embodiment:
• Uses an optocoupler to detect the telephone ringing signal
• Charging capacitor discharges to a predetermined signal level, triggering the optocoupler to connect the speaker phone automatically
• Timer limits call duration and can be bypassed with a selector switch

• Second embodiment:
• Uses a neon lamp and photocell to detect the ringing signal
• Photocell resistance decreases as light increases, triggering the photocell relay to connect the speaker phone
• Timer limits call duration and can be bypassed with a selector switch.

• The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network.
• It utilizes remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplies energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
• The system includes an optical fiber cable trunk in ring topology with telecommunications hubs and branching units.
• Branch fiber optic cables transmit and receive communications signals and unidirectionally transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than signal wavelength to power optical amplifiers.
• Hub assemblies have remote pumping and optical amplifiers located remotely, allowing for full connectivity and branch fiber optic cable cuts that only isolate the associated cable station.
• The system has advantages such as maintaining full connectivity during trunk and branch cuts, respecting sovereignty concerns, accommodating reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units, and reducing capital, operating, and maintenance costs.
</summary>

• Reduces or eliminates undersea optical repeaters
• Uses remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplied energy
• Optical fiber cable trunk in ring topology with hubs and branching units
• Branch fiber optic cables transmit communications signals and optical energy
• Hub assemblies with remote pumping and optical amplifiers
• Advantages: maintains connectivity during cuts, respects sovereignty, accommodates reconfigurable branching, reduces costs.

* The invention provides a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices with no visible fasteners when installed.
* The device consists of a two-part system: an attachment member and a cover plate member.
* The attachment member is installed using available fasteners and has latching pawls that engage saw-tooth racks on the cover plate member. The cover plate member has no fastener holes and is latched to the attachment member using the saw-tooth racks and a slot for tool insertion.
